TrackEvent.summary: The TrackEvent interface of the HTML DOM API is used for events which represent changes to a set of available tracks on an HTML media element; these events are addtrack and removetrack.

remarks.para: It's important not to confuse TrackEvent with the interface, which is used for tracks which are part of an .
Events based on TrackEvent are always sent to one of the media track list types:

TrackEventTrack.summary:
The read-only track property of
the interface specifies the media track object to which the
event applies.

remarks.para:
The media track will be an ,
, or object.

TrackEventTrack.value:
An object which is one of the types ,
, or , depending on the type of media
represented by the track. This identifies the track to which the event applies.

TrackEventTrackEvent.summary:
The TrackEvent() constructor
creates and returns a new object describing an event which
occurred on a list of tracks (,
, or ).
TrackEventTrackEvent.returns:
A new object, initialized as described by the
inputs to the constructor.
